Articles.Content: where can i get the moon landing pieces?
umm. I dunno. good ones i guess? i have seen nice landing feet and such. basically what i need currently.

Allow me to direct you to where you will find them.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=search;params=eJwtzUEOwiAQheGrGDdu3qIDteppCIVJqqFMA1RjwuEF090_X_Iy1r9tdOzrpQ71XOfUS0MRCEpjBA2YQFfQiAfuuIEUSINaTG2QF_kYJ-sWuHCbdtrnF7tiJIbvIZJKq8SB_98OMv6ZGnvOrgvb5JZ2ryLxtNlU8g9fjTYt
well gosh thanks. like I havn\'t done that already. i was asking more if anyonw knew the direct path or direct name of them. moon parts gets so many usless replies.
Well, try looking for the packs that advertise lander parts. Less than a minute gives me at least three.

I would be surprised if there was less than a dozen lander sets-

  • [li]
This pack contains lander legs, as well fuel taks, RCS tanks and an engine scaled appropriately for a small lander.[/li]
[li]Silisko edition includes lander legs, and parts appropriate for small spacecraft like landers, similar to the above, but more specific made for landing.[/li]
[li]The Challenger L.E.M. module is all the parts needed for a lander, but has no real flexibility-you can make a lander exactly as the packs intends you to, or nothing.[/li]
[li] Silisko\'s lander pack is similar, but slightly more flexible-but it hasn\'t been updated since well before the Mun was introduced, and so may be difficult to use for actual mun landings.[/li]
[li]The retro-rockets in this pack allow you to much more easily achieve a landing without legs, in case you want to try something different.[/li]
[li]These are some extremely large landing legs, in case you want to try and land something huge, and this is a parts pack for a very large (5m at widest) 2001 inspired lander.
[/li]
[li]Captain slug\'s pack includes landing legs, including ones that are easy to fit inside payload fairings, (e.g. his own or Sunday Punch\'s) allowing you to make sleeker, less ugly Mun rockets.[/li]

Personally, my recommendation is the Silisko edition, but that\'s mostly subjective-try a few out, and see which ones you prefer.
